Posts.Content: I have been taking tamoxifen for 8 months. My pesonal veiw is that it is worth taking even if you do get side effects. If it stops the cancer regrowing than it has got to be worth a go. I did have a few side effects like problems with my vision which went after 3 months and a few menapausal side effects...hot sweats. I have managed them by cutting out caffine and reduce my wine drinking. I do get cramp now but a small price to pay. My weight hasnot really change but my stomach is a little bloated. I was unlucky and had a hysterectomy 5 weeks ago. The drug had inflamed my uteris and caused me pain but since the operation i have not had that pain.....fingers crossed it doesnot return.

Posts.Content: Hi I had the same problem with clothes.This is my first summer so i am still learning what i can get away with. I have gone to charity shops and found a really lovely dress's and then found a maker who alters the straps etc.(can work out cheaper than buying a new dress).It all depends on what the fashion is and this year the cut is low. Plain T shirts under low cut tops/dress is one idea. Also tops with straps you can alter so you can bring the hight of the top up. The swimming costume bit is a little different. I have bought a costume from Nichole Jane. The only problem that i have found is that if you get out of the water too quickly you suprise the prosthesis and it slaps back on your skin and makes a bit of a noise. Have now learnt to get out of the water slowly. I know it is frustrating but to be honest i wear tops/dresses and you can sometimes see my radation marks but what the hell.The starps are hell to live with but try a skin coloured bra or wear one that you can see, make it part of the top.
